author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa and DMK president M. Karunanidhi extended their wishes to playback singer P. Susheela, who recently entered the Guinness Book of Records for singing most number of songs in Indian languages.

In her message, Ms. Jayalalithaa said she was very glad to know that Ms. Susheela has entered the Guinness Book of Records for having sung several thousands of songs and extended her hearty congratulations.

“With your interest and hard work, you have sung several thousand songs in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, Kannada and Hindi. I proudly recall that you have sung not only for me but also for my mother in films. It would not be an exaggeration to say that your voice added honour to those films,” Ms. Jayalalithaa said.

“I pray that you sing several thousand more songs and serve Tamil music,” she added.

In a statement, DMK president M. Karunanidhi said Ms. Susheela had an “irreplaceable place in the hearts of the people by singing hundreds of songs with her mellifluous voice.”

Referring to the National Film Awards, he said.

“I extend my warm wishes to all winners in the National Film Awards announced by the Centre, especially to maestro Ilayaraja.”
title: CM, Karunanidhi congratulate P. Susheela
